cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 miles south-southeast of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest and expected to turn slightly north-northwest, tracking toward the central-upper Texas coast with the cone spreading into southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast between Corpus Christi and Port O’Connor

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Port Mansfield TX to High Island TX; Hurricane Watch from north of Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass TX; Tropical Storm Watch from Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port Mansfield TX and from north of San Luis Pass to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: middle and upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) are possible late Friday into Saturday; cumulative probability 26 percent
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3-5 ft surge possible along the southwest Louisiana coast, including Calcasieu Lake and approaches to the port, if Harvey lands just west of the state line
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with locally higher totals possible, leading to life-threatening flooding in the Lake Charles area beginning as early as Friday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and possible freshwater flooding of access roads and rail approaches to the port
